title: How to go about creating my own VoIP system - Quora

response.answer_text: In the comments section for this question, the original poster wants to create a VoIP system to sell. With this in mind, there’s a lot more involved to consider than just setting up a server with software and SIP trunks.  VoIP and telecommunications have a lot more regulatory requirements to adhere to. Which means it can be more costly to maintain compliance that to actually provide service. The requirements will vary depending on where you’re at in the world. But assume you’re only looking at providing a premised based system. Then a strategy needs to be developed for the following: Hardware and software maintenanceMoves, adds and changes for VoIP devicesSecurity and complianceSIP trunkingBilling, operations and customer supportMarketingThe market shift from premise based to cloud communication solutions Don’t give up just yet. This answer isn’t meant to discourage but to provide insight to what’s involved. Let’s say you’re still ambitious and want to go down this route. Keep reading! One amazing thing with VoIP is it’s move to the cloud. There are several providers in the market that have taken out most of the above mentioned concerns by building their own infrastructure to sell service. Some are even willing and eager to partner with entrepreneurs to provide white label solutions (just Google white label VoIP). Instead of selling XYZ VoIP brand, you’re placing your own and marketing to prospective customers. By partnering in this manner, a lot of the risk is taken out of the equation. Which allows you to focus on selling while developing your reputation in the market. Plus consider how much less the capital requirements are pursuing this route. Over time, you could even revisit the idea of building out infrastructure that you own. The choice is yours to decide. White labeling is an option to consider which can take the pressure off of this incredible journey you’re own. Best wishes and I hope this helps.
